title: “I Wish They Would Come!”, illustration for Alphonse Daudet’s The Adventures of the Tartarin from Tarascon

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of pen and black ink on cream wove paper.

description: Grosz contributed nearly 100 illustrations to an edition of Alphonse Daudet’s escapist fantasy Tartarin of Tarascon. The protagonist of the novel, Tartarin, fantasizes about running away to Africa. Sitting in his room reading James Fenimore Cooper’s The Last of the Mohicans, he is ready for a make-believe battle. As the visions of lions, tomahawks, swords, and ships dance in his head, he cries out, “I wish they would come!”
medium_display: Pen and black ink on cream wove paper
inscriptions: Signed recto, lower right, in graphite: "GROSZ"; upper right, in graphite: "10 18-1/2"; verso, at center (below drawing), in graphite: "fallt weg"; lower center, in graphite: "23"; lower right, in graphite: "105" (encircled)
credit_line: Gift of Dorothy Braude Edinburg to the Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection
publication_history:
Alphonse Daudet, Die Abenteur des Herrn Tartarin aus Tarascon (Berlin: Erich Reiss Verlag, 1921), p. 29 (ill).

Alexander Dückers, George Grosz: Das druckgraphische Werk (Frankfurt am Main: Propyläen Verlag, 1979), BAI, 5, p. 109 (ill.).

Suzanne Folds McCullagh (ed.), Drawings in Dialogue: Old Master Through Modern, The Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection, exh. cat. (Chicago: The Art Institute of Chicago, 2006), p. 184, cat. 135 (ill.).
exhibition_history:
Art Institute of Chicago, "Drawings in Dialogue: Old Master Through Modern, The Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection," June 3–July 30, 2006, p. 184, cat. 135 (ill.).

Art Institute of Chicago, "The Thrill of the Chase: Drawings for the Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection," Mar. 15-June 15, 2014, no cat.
provenance_text: Private collector, Europe; sold, Sotheby’s London, Feb. 6, 2002, lot 154 (as "Figures of Time"), to Dorothy Braude Edinburg, Brookline, MA; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 2013.

input: “I Wish They Would Come!”, illustration for Alphonse Daudet’s The Adventures of the Tartarin from Tarascon
